{{No footnotes|article|date=September 2008}}
'''Caselex''' is a unique legal information service opening up national case law and other important decisions (like those of competition authorities) with a European connotation to legal professions. As such it contributes to the [[Europeanisation of law]].
== Caselex: a unique gateway to the interpretation of European law == Relying on a network of editors throughout Europe Caselex systematically summarizes in English case law and other decisions that have a cross border value to legal professionals. The service consists of the Caselex Market Definitions Module and several Case Law Modules.
== Caselex Market Definitions Module == Defining relevant markets is crucial in concentration control and antitrust cases. The ''Caselex Market Definitions Module'' gives user friendly access to English summaries of relevant markets definitions of concentration control decisions rendered by ''all'' 34 national and European competition authorities (29 [[EU member states|EU Member States]], 4 [[EFTA and the European Union|EFTA]] countries and [[Directorate-General for Competition|DG COMP]] of the [[European Commission]]) since 2000 up to today.
Accordingly, by giving an instant synoptic European-wide overview of all relevant markets defined it provides support to lawyers submitting notifications and to competition authorities responsible for concentration control under the [http://ec.europa.eu/competition/mergers/legislation/regulations.html EU 2004 Merger Control Regulation] as well as national rules thereon. Each product market is searchable on the basis of names of products and NACE codes and each definition backed up by the line of reasoning of the competition authority. Full texts of original decision are also available and downloadable in PDF.
Currently (October 2015), the database holds over 3.500 national and 900 DG COMP decisions holding more than 10.000 market definitions. The launch of this Module is foreseen in January 2016.
== Caselex Case Law Modules == Next to that Caselex covers important national case law from all EU Member States Caselex (next to case law from the [[European Court of Justice]]). Well structured English summaries allow for instant access to and full understanding of case law that would otherwise not travel across Europe. Currently (October 2015) the Modules hold almost 5.000 summaries covering the following areas of law: * [[EU competition law|Competition Law]] * [[Employment law|Employment Law]] * [[Public procurement law|Public procurement Law]] * [[Media law|ICT and Media Law]] * [[Social Law Library|Social Security Law]]
== See also == * [[European Union Law|Law of the European Union]] * [[Europeanisation of law]] * [[EUR-Lex]] * [[Harmonisation of law]]
== External links == * [http://caselex.eu Caselex' official homepage] (under construction)
== Sources == * NRC Handelsblad (http://www.nrc.nl/), "Caselex: googelen voor eurojuristen", 14.2.2008

{{Infobox song | name = Dark Horse | cover = DarkHorseCover.png | alt = | border = yes | type = single | artist = [[Katy Perry]] featuring [[Juicy J]] | album = [[Prism (Katy Perry album)|Prism]] | released = December 17, 2013 | format = {{hlist|[[CD single|CD]]|[[Music download|digital download]]}} | recorded = | studio = {{ubl|Playback Recording Studios|{{small|([[Santa Barbara, California]])}}|[[MXM Studios]]|{{small|([[Stockholm]], [[Sweden]])}}|Luke's in the Boo|{{small|([[Malibu, California]])}}|Secret Garden Studios|{{small|([[Montecito, California]])}}}} | venue = | genre = {{hlist|[[Trap music|Trap]]|[[Hip hop music|hip hop]]}} | length = 3:35 | label = [[Capitol Records|Capitol]] | writer = {{hlist|Katy Perry|[[Juicy J|Jordan Houston]]|[[Dr. Luke|Lukasz Gottwald]]|[[Sarah Hudson (singer)|Sarah Hudson]]|[[Max Martin]]|[[Cirkut (record producer)|Henry Walter]]}} | producer = {{hlist|[[Dr. Luke]]|Max Martin|[[Cirkut (record producer)|Cirkut]]}} | chronology = [[Katy Perry]] | prev_title = [[Unconditionally]] | prev_year = 2013 | next_title = [[Birthday (Katy Perry song)|Birthday]] | next_year = 2014 | misc = {{Extra chronology | artist = [[Juicy J]] | type = single | prev_title = [[Lolly (song)|Lolly]] | prev_year = 2013 | title = Dark Horse | year = 2013 | next_title = Talkin' Bout | next_year = 2014 }} {{External music video|{{YouTube|0KSOMA3QBU0|"Dark Horse ft. Juicy J"}} }} }} "'''Dark Horse'''" is a song recorded by American singer [[Katy Perry]] featuring rapper [[Juicy J]]. It was originally released on September 17, 2013, by [[Capitol Records]] as the first promotional single from Perry's fourth [[studio album]], ''[[Prism (Katy Perry album)|Prism]]'' (2013). Three months later, it was released as the third official single on December 17. Both artists co-wrote the song with its producers, [[Max Martin]], [[Cirkut (record producer)|Cirkut]], and [[Dr. Luke]], alongside [[Sarah Hudson (singer)|Sarah Hudson]]. It was conceived by Perry and Hudson during a writing session in Perry's hometown of [[Santa Barbara, California]], and Juicy J was later commissioned for a verse on the song.
"Dark Horse" combines the genres of [[Trap music (hip hop)|trap]] and [[Hip hop music|hip hop]], replicating what has been described as a "[[Southern rap]]-[[techno]] mashup". The track features a minimal production, with a "seductive" and "mature" tone to Perry's vocals, while Juicy J is featured on the song's intro and [[Rapping|rapped]] [[Bridge (music)|bridge]]. Perry, in interviews, said she wanted the song to have a "witchy, [[Spell (paranormal)|spell]]-y kind of [[black magic]]-y idea", so she wrote it from the perspective of a [[witch]] warning a man not to [[falling in love|fall in love]] with her because if he does, she will be his last. The song was part of a competition sponsored by [[Pepsi]] in which fans could vote via [[Twitter]] on whether they would prefer either "Dark Horse" or "[[Walking on Air (Katy Perry song)|Walking on Air]]" to be released as the first promotional single from ''Prism''.
"Dark Horse" was a commercial success, charting at number one in Canada, the [[Netherlands]] and the United States. It also reached the top ten in almost 20 countries including [[New Zealand]], United Kingdom, [[Sweden]] and [[Venezuela]] as well as the Digital Songs chart of ''Billboard'' magazine.<ref name="Caulfield">{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5855135/beyonce-leads-for-third-week-at-no-1-on-billboard-200-chart |title=Beyonce Leads for Third Week at No. 1 on Billboard 200 Chart |first=Keith |last=Caulfield |work=Billboard |date=January 2, 2014 |accessdate=January 2, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140104075520/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5855135/beyonce-leads-for-third-week-at-no-1-on-billboard-200-chart |archivedate=January 4, 2014 }}</ref> Billboard identified Dark Horse as cementing trap music's place on the charts.<ref>https://www.billboard.com/articles/events/year-in-music-2015/6804537/justin-bieber-omi-kygo-lillywood-robin-schulz-mr-probs-tropical-house-hits-2015</ref> Perry first performed the song live at the 2013 [[iHeartRadio Music Festival]] in [[Las Vegas]] on September 20, 2013. The song's first major television performance was at the [[56th Annual Grammy Awards]] on January 26, 2014.<ref name="GrammyPerformance2014" /> "Dark Horse" was nominated for [[Grammy Award for Best Pop Duo/Group Performance|Best Pop Duo/Group Performance]] at the [[57th Annual Grammy Awards]]. The song has sold 13.2 million units (combined sales and track-equivalent streams), becoming the second best-selling song worldwide for 2014.<ref name="Ifpi2015">{{cite web|title=IFPI publishes Digital Music Report 2015 |url=http://www.ifpi.org/news/Global-digital-music-revenues-match-physical-format-sales-for-first-time |publisher=International Federation of the Phonographic Industry |date=14 April 2015 |accessdate=15 April 2015 |page=12 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150414194629/http://www.ifpi.org/news/Global-digital-music-revenues-match-physical-format-sales-for-first-time |archivedate=April 14, 2015 }}</ref>
==Production and release== Inspired by the 1996 film ''[[The Craft (film)|The Craft]]'',<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/5763220/katy-perry-reveals-prism-influences-adds-stripped-down |title=Katy Perry Reveals 'Prism' Influences, Adds Stripped-Down Performances at Album Release Event |author=Rutherford, Kevin |work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |accessdate=February 11, 2014 |date=October 22, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131027052306/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/5763220/katy-perry-reveals-prism-influences-adds-stripped-down |archivedate=October 27, 2013 }}</ref> Perry and singer-songwriter Sarah Hudson wrote the first version of "Dark Horse" in Perry's hometown of [[Santa Barbara, California]].<ref name="MTV1">{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1713269/katy-perry-dark-horse-prism.jhtml |title=Katy Perry's 'Dark Horse' Is A 'Warning' |first=Christina |last=Garibaldi |publisher=[[MTV News]] |date=August 29, 2013 |accessdate=December 8, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131203083356/http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1713269/katy-perry-dark-horse-prism.jhtml |archivedate=December 3, 2013 }}</ref> Perry described the song as a "[[wiktionary:juxtaposition|juxtaposition]]", as it mixed her, a [[pop music]] artist, with an "urban kind of [[hip-hop]]-flavored background soundtrack"; and its lyrics as "witchy and dark", written from the perspective of "a witch warning [a] man to not fall in love with [her]", and if so, she would be his last. Perry then asked producer [[Dr. Luke]] to contact one of his [[Kemosabe Records]] artists, American rapper [[Juicy J]], for a guest verse. Juicy J complimented Perry as having a "very professional" work ethic and being substantially involved in the song's development. He said: "My verse I did on that song, she was singing it. She's really a genius, she was by the mixing board and telling the guy what to take in and take out. She's really hands-on with her music, she knows music."<ref name="Collab">{{cite web|url=http://news.mtv.ca/news/music/katy-perrys-dark-horse-shows-off-her-genius-juicy-j-says/ |title=Katy Perry's 'Dark Horse' Shows Off Her 'Genius,' Juicy J Says |first=Rob |last=Markman |publisher=MTV News. Viacom |date=September 10, 2013 |accessdate=September 22, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141006084633/http://news.mtv.ca/news/music/katy-perrys-dark-horse-shows-off-her-genius-juicy-j-says/ |archivedate=October 6, 2014 }}</ref>
"Dark Horse" was recorded and engineered at Luke's in the Boo in [[Malibu, California|Malibu]], [[Conway Recording Studios]] in [[Hollywood]], Playback Recording Studios in Santa Barbara, California, and Secret Garden Studios in [[Montecito, California|Montecito]], as well as [[MXM Studios]] in [[Stockholm]], [[Sweden]]. It was engineered by Peter Carlsson, Mike "Crazy Mike" Foster, Clint Gibbs, Sam Holland, and Michael Ilbert. They were assisted by Eric Eylands, Rachael Findlen, Justin Fox, Elliot Lanam, and Cory Bice. It was mixed by Serban Ghenea, while John Hanes served as the engineer for mix. All instrumentation and programming was done by Dr. Luke, Max Martin, and Cirkut.<ref name="Notes">{{cite AV media notes|others=Katy Perry|title=[[Prism (Katy Perry album)|Prism]]|year=2013|type= inlay cover |publisher= [[Capitol Records]]|page=6}}</ref>
In a press release on August 20, 2013, [[Pepsi]] announced a partnership with Perry to promote her fourth studio album ''Prism'': a social "[[Twitter|tweet]]-to-unlock" voting program, encouraging fans to tweet the hashtag #KATYNOW in exchange for song titles and lyrics. The chosen tracks for the campaign were "Walking on Air" and "Dark Horse". After the samples were revealed, fans could vote for which one they wanted to have an early release on digital retailers.<ref>{{cite web|title=Pepsi And MTV Team Up With Global Superstar Katy Perry For Special Finale Performance From Undisclosed Location In Brooklyn During The 2013 'MTV Video Music Awards' |url=http://www.pepsico.com/PressRelease/Pepsi-And-MTV-Team-Up-With-Global-Superstar-Katy-Perry-For-Special-Finale-Perfor08202013.html |publisher=[[PepsiCo]] |accessdate=December 17, 2013 |date=August 20, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131216184104/http://www.pepsico.com/PressRelease/Pepsi-And-MTV-Team-Up-With-Global-Superstar-Katy-Perry-For-Special-Finale-Perfor08202013.html |archivedate=December 16, 2013 }}</ref> The winner was "Dark Horse", which was released on September 17, 2013 on the [[iTunes Store]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Lee, Christina |title=Katy Perry Will Drop 'Dark Horse' (Featuring Juicy J) As Her Next 'Prism' Single |url=http://www.idolator.com/7480598/katy-perry-next-prism-single-dark-horse-juicy-j |publisher=[[Idolator (website)|Idolator]]. [[SpinMedia]]. |accessdate=January 10, 2014 |date=August 26, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140110184138/http://www.idolator.com/7480598/katy-perry-next-prism-single-dark-horse-juicy-j |archivedate=January 10, 2014 }}</ref> Due to its commercial success, it was sent to [[Contemporary hit radio|contemporary hit]] and [[Rhythmic contemporary|rhythmic]] radio stations on December 17, 2013 as ''Prism''{{'}}s third official single.<ref name="Trust" /><ref name="plaympe">{{cite web|url=http://daily.plaympe.com/katy-perry-feat-juicy-j-dark-horse-2/ |title=Katy Perry feat. Juicy J – Dark Horse |publisher=Play MPE. Destiny Media Technologies |date=December 17, 2013 |accessdate=December 18, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131219063251/http://daily.plaympe.com/katy-perry-feat-juicy-j-dark-horse-2/ |archivedate=December 19, 2013 }}</ref>
==Composition== "Dark Horse" has been described as a "[[Southern rap]]-[[techno]] mashup",<ref name="Denver">{{cite web|url=http://www.denverpost.com/ci_24032311/katy-perry-previews-new-album-prism-at-nyc |title=Katy Perry Previews New Album ‘Prism’ at NYC Event |first=Mesfin |last=Fedaku |work=[[The Denver Post]] |date=September 6, 2013 |accessdate=September 6, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130908120125/http://www.denverpost.com/ci_24032311/katy-perry-previews-new-album-prism-at-nyc |archivedate=September 8, 2013 }}</ref> combining [[Trap music (hip hop)|trap]]<ref name="Trap">{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/5687099/katy-perrys-prism-album-preview-10-things-you-need-to-know |title=Katy Perry's 'Prism' Album Preview: 10 Things You Need To Know |first=Jason |last=Lipshutz |work=Billboard |date=September 6, 2013 |accessdate=September 22, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304072407/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/5687099/katy-perrys-prism-album-preview-10-things-you-need-to-know |archivedate=March 4, 2016 }}</ref><ref name="Trap1">{{cite web|url=http://consequenceofsound.net/2013/09/listen-katy-perry-goes-trap-with-juicy-j-on-dark-horse/ |title=Listen: Katy Perry goes trap with Juicy J on "Dark Horse" |publisher=[[Consequence of Sound]] |date=September 17, 2013 |accessdate=September 22, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130921151619/http://consequenceofsound.net/2013/09/listen-katy-perry-goes-trap-with-juicy-j-on-dark-horse/ |archivedate=September 21, 2013 }}</ref> and [[Hip hop music|hip hop]],<ref name="Billboard2">{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/5687099/katy-perrys-prism-album-preview-10-things-you-need-to-know |title=Katy Perry's 'Prism' Album Preview: 10 Things You Need To Know |first=Jason |last=Lipshutz |work=Billboard |date=September 6, 2013 |accessdate=September 6, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304072407/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/5687099/katy-perrys-prism-album-preview-10-things-you-need-to-know |archivedate=March 4, 2016 }}</ref><ref name="Billboard3">{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/5695549/miley-cyrus-britney-spears-katy-perry-whose-new-song-is-best |title=Miley Cyrus, Britney Spears, Katy Perry: Whose New Song Is Best? |work=Billboard |date=September 17, 2013 |accessdate=September 22, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130922051500/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/5695549/miley-cyrus-britney-spears-katy-perry-whose-new-song-is-best |archivedate=September 22, 2013 }}</ref> and has a length of three minutes and thirty-five seconds.<ref name="iTunes">{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/ca/album/prism-deluxe-version/id690928033 |title=Katy Perry — "Prism" |publisher=[[iTunes Store]] |date=September 17, 2013 |accessdate=September 17, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131012053806/https://itunes.apple.com/ca/album/prism-deluxe-version/id690928033 |archivedate=October 12, 2013 }}</ref> Musically, the verses are built around icy rhythms and [[chopped and screwed]] vocal samples, while the chorus' feature Perry singing into a gradual [[crescendo]].<ref name="Billboard">{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/5695532/katy-perry-teams-with-juicy-j-on-dark-horse-hear-the-new-track |title=Katy Perry Teams With Juicy J on 'Dark Horse': Hear The New Track |first=Jason |last=Lipshutz |work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |date=September 17, 2013 |accessdate=September 22, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130921084910/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/5695532/katy-perry-teams-with-juicy-j-on-dark-horse-hear-the-new-track |archivedate=September 21, 2013 }}</ref> The song contains a grimy, "incredibly simplistic" production.<ref name="Trap" /> According to Kathy Iandoli of [[MSN Entertainment]], "Dark Horse" contains a mixture of elements from "trippy [[Pop music|pop]]", [[Electronic dance music|EDM]], and [[dubstep]].<ref name="MSN">{{cite web|url=http://social.entertainment.msn.com/music/blogs/post--katy-perry-enlists-juicy-j-for-her-fan-voted-next-single-dark-horse |title=Katy Perry enlists Juicy J for her fan-voted next single 'Dark Horse' |first=Kathy |last=Iandoli |work=[[MSN Entertainment]] |publisher=[[Microsoft]] |date=September 17, 2013 |accessdate=December 8, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131226203203/http://social.entertainment.msn.com/music/blogs/post--katy-perry-enlists-juicy-j-for-her-fan-voted-next-single-dark-horse |archivedate=December 26, 2013 }}</ref> According to the sheet music published at Musicnotes.com, "Dark Horse" is written in the key of [[B-flat minor|B{{music|flat}} minor]]. It follows a chord progression of G{{music|flat}} – D{{music|flat}} – B{{music|flat}}m – B{{music|flat}}m/A{{music|flat}}, and the vocals range from the low note of [[B♭ (musical note)|B{{music|flat}}<sub>3</sub>]] to the high note of [[D♭ (musical note)|D{{music|flat}}<sub>5</sub>]]. "Dark Horse" has a tempo of 132 beats per minute in half-time style typical of trap music.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.musicnotes.com/sheetmusic/mtdFPE.asp?ppn=MN0125299 |title=Unsupported Browser or Operating System |publisher=Musicnotes.com |accessdate=March 4, 2014}}</ref>
A writer for the ''[[Winnipeg Free Press]]'' described the song as "brooding, borderline sleazy trap-pop excursion that comes across like a stripped-down version of "[[E.T. (song)|E.T.]]" mixed with "[[Grindin']]" by [[The Clipse]]," before going on to call it unexpected, unconventional, and unstoppable.<ref name="Winnipeg">{{cite web|url=http://www.winnipegfreepress.com/arts-and-life/entertainment/music/new-music-225307012.html |title=New music |work=[[Winnipeg Free Press]] |publisher=Bob Cox |date=September 26, 2013 |accessdate=December 11, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131003060656/http://www.winnipegfreepress.com/arts-and-life/entertainment/music/new-music-225307012.html |archivedate=October 3, 2013 }}</ref>
==Critical reception== [[File:Three 6 Mafia.jpg|thumb|200px|left|Critical response to [[Juicy J]]'s guest vocals was generally negative.]] Marc Hogan from ''[[Spin (magazine)|Spin]]'' called the lyrics a "cliché salad" but believed that the song had potential to become a hit due to its "soaring hooks" and "sleekly sculpted production".<ref>{{cite web|title=Katy Perry and Juicy J's Trap-Minded 'Dark Horse' Easily Beats the Spread |url=https://www.spin.com/2013/09/katy-perry-juicy-j-dark-horse-prism-stream/ |work=[[Spin (magazine)|Spin]] |accessdate=January 9, 2014 |date=September 17, 2013 |author=Hogan, Marc |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140125112500/https://www.spin.com/2013/09/katy-perry-juicy-j-dark-horse-prism-stream/ |archivedate=January 25, 2014 }}</ref> Reviewing the song for ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'', Jason Lipshutz said that by exploring trap-influenced music, Perry "score[d]" and "slay[ed]".<ref>{{cite web|title=Katy Perry's 'PRISM': Track-By-Track Review |author=Lipshutz, Jason |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/review/5763162/katy-perrys-prism-track-by-track-review |work=Billboard |accessdate=February 10, 2014 |date=October 21, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140219095623/http://www.billboard.com/articles/review/5763162/katy-perrys-prism-track-by-track-review |archivedate=February 19, 2014 }}</ref> [[Digital Spy]]'s Robert Copsey questioned the decision to not have a proper chorus in "Dark Horse" and the inclusion of [[Juicy J]], though he praised the "sleazy" beat and "sultry" vocals from Katy Perry. He gave the track a rating of four stars out of five.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/review/a544861/katy-perry-dark-horse-review-a-strangely-addictive-curveball.html |title=Katy Perry: 'Dark Horse' review: 'A strangely addictive curveball' |date=January 17, 2014 |accessdate=February 10, 2014 |work=[[Digital Spy]] |author=Copsey, Robert |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140201113827/http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/music/review/a544861/katy-perry-dark-horse-review-a-strangely-addictive-curveball.html |archivedate=February 1, 2014 }}</ref> Contributor Dylan Mial of [[Blogcritics]] said the "[[wiktionary:juxtaposition|juxtaposition]]" of Perry's vocals and Juicy J's rap brought "the ingredients for a perfect musical storm" and favored Perry for the "uniqueness" of the single.<ref name="blogcritics">{{cite web|title=Music Review: Katy Perry – "Dark Horse" Single|date=October 1, 2013|accessdate=February 10, 2014|url=http://blogcritics.org/music-review-katy-perry-dark-horse-single/|publisher=[[Blogcritics]]|author=Mial, Dylan}}</ref>
Keith Murphy from ''[[Vibe (magazine)|Vibe]]'' called the track "infectiously sexy",<ref>{{cite web|work=[[Vibe (magazine)|Vibe]] |accessdate=February 10, 2014 |date=September 18, 2013 |title=Review: Katy Perry Visits The Trap (With Juicy J) On 'Dark Horse' |url=http://www.vibe.com/article/review-katy-perry-visits-trap-juicy-j-dark-horse |author=Murphy, Keith |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140217170746/http://www.vibe.com/article/review-katy-perry-visits-trap-juicy-j-dark-horse |archivedate=February 17, 2014 }}</ref> while John Walker from MTV was similarly positive about the song, though he wrote that Juicy's verse was "phoned-in".<ref>{{cite web|last=Walker |first=John |publisher=[[MTV]] |accessdate=February 10, 2014 |date=October 22, 2013 |title=Katy Perry's 'Prism': A Track-By-Track Review..... In Cat GIFs! |url=http://buzzworthy.mtv.com/2013/10/22/katy-perry-prism-review-cat-gifs/ |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140206163508/http://buzzworthy.mtv.com/2013/10/22/katy-perry-prism-review-cat-gifs |archivedate=February 6, 2014 }}</ref> Sal Cinquemani of ''[[Slant Magazine]]'' likened the song to avant-garde band [[Art of Noise]]'s song "Moments In Love" and called it a "continuation" of "[[E.T. (song)|E.T.]]", and further labelled it as a "standout" from ''Prism''.<ref>{{cite web|work=Slant |accessdate=February 10, 2014 |date=October 17, 2013 |author=Cinquemani, Sal |title=Katy Perry — Prism |url=http://www.slantmagazine.com/music/review/katy-perry-prism |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140125115444/http://www.slantmagazine.com/music/review/katy-perry-prism |archivedate=January 25, 2014 }}</ref> While she did not give her opinion of the song as a whole, Helen Brown from the publication ''[[The Daily Telegraph]]'' criticized Juicy J for his "daft" rap.<ref name="telegraph">{{cite web|title=Katy Perry, Prism, review |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/music/rockandpopreviews/10386191/Katy-Perry-Prism-review.html |work=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |accessdate=February 10, 2014 |date=October 17, 2013 |author=Brown, Helen |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140126035023/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/culture/music/rockandpopreviews/10386191/Katy-Perry-Prism-review.html |archivedate=January 26, 2014 }}</ref> For [[AbsolutePunk]], Craig Manning classified "Dark Horse" as ''Prism''{{'}}s worst song, while also panning the rapper's contribution.<ref>{{cite web|publisher=[[AbsolutePunk]] |accessdate=February 10, 2014 |date=October 28, 2013 |title=Katy Perry - Prism |url=http://www.absolutepunk.net/showthread.php?t=3502811 |author=Manning, Craig |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20140210213748/http://www.absolutepunk.net/showthread.php?t=3502811 |archivedate=February 10, 2014 }}</ref> Marah Eakin from ''[[The A.V. Club]]'' was not entirely critical of the song, though she noted that it was not among "Perry's best".<ref>{{cite web|work=[[The A.V. Club]] |publisher=[[The Onion]] |accessdate=February 10, 2014 |date=October 22, 2013 |author=Eakin, Marah |title=Katy Perry: Prism |url=http://www.avclub.com/review/katy-perry-iprismi-104560 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140218014302/http://www.avclub.com/review/katy-perry-iprismi-104560 |archivedate=February 18, 2014 }}</ref>
[[Consequence of Sound]]'s Chris Bosman had a mixed response—while he praised the song for feeling "vital" and "forward-moving", he criticized the guest vocals and nonetheless deemed the trap influence "trap for soccer moms".<ref>{{cite web|publisher=[[Consequence of Sound]] |accessdate=February 10, 2014 |date=October 21, 2013 |title=Album Review: Katy Perry — Prism |url=http://consequenceofsound.net/2013/10/album-review-katy-perry-prism/ |author=Bosman, Chris |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140210155350/http://consequenceofsound.net/2013/10/album-review-katy-perry-prism/ |archivedate=February 10, 2014 }}</ref> Writing for [[ABC News]], Mesfin Fekadu commented that "her team fare[d] better" in the song and observed that the "Southern hip-hop and electronic flavors" present on it were factors that made it "work".<ref>{{cite web|publisher=[[ABC News]]. [[American Broadcasting Company]]. |accessdate=February 10, 2014 |author=Fekadu, Mesfin |title=Music Review: Katy Perry Plays It Safe on 'Prism' |date=October 21, 2013 |url=http://abcnews.go.com/m/story?id=20636044 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140125180258/http://abcnews.go.com/m/story?id=20636044 |archivedate=January 25, 2014 }}</ref> Pop music website [[Idolator (website)|Idolator]]'s Sam Lansky opined that the "weird trap-lite" of the song "never quite [[wiktionary:coalesce|coalesces]]".<ref>{{cite web|publisher=[[Idolator (website)|Idolator]]. [[Spin Media]]. |accessdate=February 10, 2014 |date=October 22, 2013 |title=Katy Perry's 'Prism': Album Review |url=http://www.idolator.com/7489676/katy-perry-prism-review |author=Lansky, Sam |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140205140143/http://www.idolator.com/7489676/katy-perry-prism-review |archivedate=February 5, 2014 }}</ref> The song was nominated for [[MTV Europe Music Award for Best Song|Best Song]] at the [[2014 MTV Europe Music Awards]], though lost to [[Ariana Grande]]'s "[[Problem (Ariana Grande song)|Problem]]".<ref>{{cite web|title=2014 MTV EMAs: The Complete Winners List |url=http://www.etonline.com/awards/153667_2014_mtv_emas_the_complete_winners_list/ |publisher=Entertainment Tonight |accessdate=December 6, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141128094657/http://www.etonline.com/awards/153667_2014_mtv_emas_the_complete_winners_list/ |archivedate=November 28, 2014 }}</ref> It has been nominated for [[Grammy Award for Best Pop Duo/Group Performance|Best Pop Duo/Group Performance]] at the [[57th Annual Grammy Awards]].<ref>{{cite news|last1=Moraski |first1=Lauren |title=Grammy Awards 2015 nominations announced |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/grammy-awards-2015-nominations-announced/ |accessdate=December 6, 2014 |publisher=CBS News |date=December 5, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20141205170353/http://www.cbsnews.com/news/grammy-awards-2015-nominations-announced/ |archivedate=December 5, 2014 }}</ref>
==Accolades== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Awards ! Category ! Result |- |rowspan="11"| 2014 |[[MuchMusic Video Awards]] |[[MuchMusic Video Award for Best International Artist Video|Best International Artist Video]] |rowspan=4 {{nom}} |- |[[2014 Premios Juventud|Premios Juventud]] |Favorite Hit |- |[[2014 Teen Choice Awards|Teen Choice Awards]] | [[2014 Teen Choice Awards#Choice Music|Choice Music: Single by a Female Artist]] |- |rowspan="2"| [[2014 MTV Video Music Awards|MTV Video Music Awards]] |[[MTV Video Music Award for Best Collaboration|Best Collaboration]] |- |[[MTV Video Music Award for Best Female Video|Best Female Video]] |{{won}} |- |rowspan="2"| [[2014 MTV Europe Music Awards|MTV Europe Music Awards]] |[[MTV Europe Music Award for Best Song|Best Song]] |{{nom}} |- |[[MTV Europe Music Award for Best Video|Best Video]] |rowspan=2 {{won}} |- |[[American Music Awards of 2014|American Music Awards]] |[[American Music Award for Single of the Year|Single of the Year]] |- |MP3 Music Awards |Radio/Charts/Downloads Award |rowspan=8 {{nom}} |- |[[Los Premios 40 Principales 2014|Los Premios 40 Principales]] | Best International Video |- | [[NRJ Music Awards]] | Video of the Year |- |rowspan="5"|2015 |[[57th Annual Grammy Awards|Grammy Awards]] |[[Grammy Award for Best Pop Duo/Group Performance|Best Pop Duo/Group Performance]] |- |[[ADG Excellence in Production Design Award]] |Short Format: Web Series, Music Video or Commercial |- |[[Myx Music Award]]s |[[Myx Music Award for Favorite International Video|Favorite International Video]] |- |[[2015 Kids' Choice Awards|Kids' Choice Awards]] |Favorite Song Of The Year |- |[[iHeartRadio Music Awards]] | Best Collaboration |- |}
==Chart performance== ===North America=== On the [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]], the song debuted at number seventeen on the week ending October 5, 2013. It also debuted at number four on the [[Hot Digital Songs]] chart with 194,000 downloads.<ref name="Billboard4">{{cite journal|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5733088/miley-cyrus-wrecking-ball-spends-second-week-atop-hot-100?chartDate=2013-10-05order=gainer&order=gainer |title=Miley Cyrus' 'Wrecking Ball' Spends Second Week Atop Hot 100 |work=Billboard |accessdate=September 25, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140513210217/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5733088/miley-cyrus-wrecking-ball-spends-second-week-atop-hot-100?chartDate=2013-10-05order%3Dgainer&order=gainer |archivedate=May 13, 2014 }}</ref> In response to the unexpected success of "Dark Horse", Capitol Records executive VP [[Greg Thompson (music executive)|Greg Thompson]] stated: "Katy's well aware of [the success of] 'Dark Horse'" and "It might be the next single. We're watching it – and certainly appreciating the airplay – while still wanting 'Unconditionally' to have a full run".<ref name="Trust">{{cite journal|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/5819941/katy-perry-rides-in-on-a-dark-horse-her-aptly-titled-unexpected |title=Katy Perry Rides In On A 'Dark Horse,' Her Aptly Titled, Unexpected Hit (Updated) |work=Billboard |date=December 9, 2013 |accessdate=December 18, 2013 |last=Trust |first=Gary |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161111132238/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/5819941/katy-perry-rides-in-on-a-dark-horse-her-aptly-titled-unexpected |archivedate=November 11, 2016 }}</ref> In December, following its success as a promotional single, it was chosen as the third official single from ''Prism''.<ref>{{cite web|last=Wass |first=Mike |title=Katy Perry Selects 'Dark Horse' as the Third Single from 'Prism' |url=http://www.idolator.com/7498859/katy-perry-selects-dark-horse-as-the-third-single-from-prism |publisher=Idolator |accessdate=January 9, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131230234026/http://www.idolator.com/7498859/katy-perry-selects-dark-horse-as-the-third-single-from-prism |archivedate=December 30, 2013 }}</ref> On the week ending January 11, 2014, "Dark Horse" sold 285,000 copies (up 158%) ranking at number 7 on [[Hot Digital Songs]] chart. The following week the song rose to number 6 on the ''Billboard'' Hot 100, and number 4 on the Digital Songs chart selling 229,000 copies. The song became the thirteenth Top 10 song for the singer, and Juicy J's first top 10 on chart.<ref name="Caulfield" /> That same week, the song debuted at number thirty-four on ''Billboard'' [[Hot Dance Club Songs]]. The song also rose to number fifteen on ''Billboard'' [[Mainstream Top 40|Pop Songs]], earning greatest gainer honours.<ref name="Trust" /><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/5862304/chart-highlights-beyonce-bounds-up-pop-rbhip-hop-charts-with |title=Chart Highlights: Beyonce Bounds Up Pop, R&B/Hip-Hop Charts With 'Drunk In Love,' 'XO' |first=Gary |last=Trust |work=Billboard |date=January 6, 2014 |accessdate=January 8, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140109044537/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/5862304/chart-highlights-beyonce-bounds-up-pop-rbhip-hop-charts-with |archivedate=January 9, 2014 }}</ref> The following week the song topped the Hot Digital Songs, selling 243,000 copies, and rose to number 4 on the Billboard Hot 100.<ref name="billboard.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5869748/frozen-chills-for-second-week-at-no-1-on-billboard-200 |title='Frozen' Chills For Second Week At No. 1 On Billboard 200 |first=Keith |last=Caulfield |work=Billboard |date=January 15, 2014 |accessdate=January 15, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140117160222/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5869748/frozen-chills-for-second-week-at-no-1-on-billboard-200 |archivedate=January 17, 2014 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5869763/pitbull-kesha-timber-remains-atop-hot-100 |title=Pitbull and Ke$ha's 'Timber' Remains Atop Hot 100 |first=Gary |last=Trust |work=Billboard |date=January 15, 2014 |accessdate=January 15, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140117160229/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5869763/pitbull-kesha-timber-remains-atop-hot-100 |archivedate=January 17, 2014 }}</ref> On the week-ending February 1, 2014 "Dark Horse" topped the Hot Digital Song for a second week, selling 261,000 copies and rose to number 2 on the Billboard Hot 100.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5877848/bruce-springsteen-high-hopes-11th-no-1-album-billboard-200-chart |title=Bruce Springsteen Scores 11th No. 1 Album on Billboard 200 |first=Keith |last=Caulfield |work=Billboard |date=January 22, 2014 |accessdate=January 23, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140123070758/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5877848/bruce-springsteen-high-hopes-11th-no-1-album-billboard-200-chart |archivedate=January 23, 2014 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5877859/pitbull-kehas-timber-still-tops-hot-100-bastille-lorde-reach-top-10 |title=Pitbull & Ke$ha's 'Timber' Still Tops Hot 100; Bastille, Lorde Reach Top 10 |first=Gary |last=Trust |work=Billboard |date=January 22, 2014 |accessdate=January 23, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140123081527/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5877859/pitbull-kehas-timber-still-tops-hot-100-bastille-lorde-reach-top-10 |archivedate=January 23, 2014 }}</ref> The following week, February 8, the song still remains atop the Hot Digital Song adding another 294,000 units to the number of copies sold during the previous weeks.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5885814/grammy-awards-generate-sales-gains-on-billboard-charts |title=GRAMMY Awards Generates Sales Gains On Billboard Charts |first=Keith |last=Caulfield |work=Billboard |date=January 29, 2014 |accessdate=January 29, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140131084040/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5885814/grammy-awards-generate-sales-gains-on-billboard-charts |archivedate=January 31, 2014 }}</ref> On January 29, 2014, "Dark Horse" reached the number one position in the United States, giving Perry her ninth US number one and tying her with four other artists as the artist with the tenth highest number ones in history, and also becoming Juicy J's first number one US hit. Perry also set a new record, becoming the only artist to have a number one single in each year of the decade thus far.<ref name="NumberOneBillboard">{{cite web|last=Trust |first=Gary |title=Katy Perry's 'Dark Horse' Gallops to No. 1 on Hot 100 |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5885830/katy-perry-dark-horse-hot-100-no-1 |work=Billboard |accessdate=January 29, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140131082410/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5885830/katy-perry-dark-horse-hot-100-no-1 |archivedate=January 31, 2014 }}</ref> The song topped the chart for four straight weeks, from February 8 to March 1. It was replaced by [[Pharrell Williams]]' "[[Happy (Pharrell Williams song)|Happy]]".<ref>{{cite web|title=Pharrell Williams' 'Happy' Hits No. 1 On Hot 100 |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5915783/pharrell-williams-happy-hits-no-1-on-hot-100 |publisher=NielsenSoundscan |author=Trust, Gary |accessdate=February 26, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140228104221/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5915783/pharrell-williams-happy-hits-no-1-on-hot-100 |archivedate=February 28, 2014 }}</ref> The song also broke Perry's record for her longest stay within the top 10 for one single - as "Dark Horse" has spent 22 weeks within the top ten so far, breaking her previous record set by "[[E.T. (song)|E.T.]]" of 20 weeks.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/6106532/iggy-azalea-hot-100-fancy-magic-calvin-harris |work=Billboard |title=Iggy Azalea Remains Atop Hot 100 With 'Fancy'; MAGIC!, Calvin Harris Hit Top 10 |first=Gary |last=Trust |date=2014-06-04 |accessdate=2014-06-04 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140606210505/http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/6106532/iggy-azalea-hot-100-fancy-magic-calvin-harris |archivedate=June 6, 2014 }}</ref> The song has spent 52 weeks on the Hot 100 as of September 18, 2014, becoming Perry's first song to last at least a year on the chart.<ref>{{cite web|title=Katy Perry - Chart history |url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/305595/Katy+Perry/chart?f=793 |work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |accessdate=September 24, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140629090241/http://www.billboard.com/artist/305595/Katy%20Perry/chart?f=793 |archivedate=June 29, 2014 }}</ref> By May 2014, "Dark Horse" has sold over 5 million copies in the US, and become Perry's 6th song to surpass the 5 million mark.<ref name="Dark Horse Digital Sales 2014">{{cite news|title=Chart Watch: MJ Makes Hot 100 History |url=https://music.yahoo.com/blogs/chart-watch/chart-watch-mj-makes-hot-100-history-225547952.html |author=Paul Grein |publisher=Yahoo! |date=May 21, 2014 |accessdate=May 22, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140522043849/https://music.yahoo.com/blogs/chart-watch/chart-watch-mj-makes-hot-100-history-225547952.html |archivedate=May 22, 2014 }}</ref> It became the third best-selling song of 2014 in the United States with 4.43 million copies sold for the year.<ref name="us sales 2014">{{cite web|url=https://www.yahoo.com/music/its-official-pharrell-has-2014s-best-selling-106748836876.html |title=It's Official: Pharrell Has 2014's Best-Selling Song |author=Paul Grein |date=December 31, 2014 |publisher=Yahoo! Music |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150401070235/https://www.yahoo.com/music/its-official-pharrell-has-2014s-best-selling-106748836876.html |archivedate=April 1, 2015 }}</ref> As of February 2017, the song has sold 6.3 million copies in the nation,<ref name=USsales>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/7694308/ask-billboard-katy-perrys-career-song-album-sales |title=Ask Billboard: Katy Perry's Career Song & Album Sales |website=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |accessdate=February 20, 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170222052835/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/7694308/ask-billboard-katy-perrys-career-song-album-sales |archivedate=February 22, 2017 }}</ref> and been certified Diamond by the [[Recording Industry Association of America]] (RIAA).The single have sold more than 17 million worlwide as of June,2018.<ref name=RIAA/>
Aside from topping the Hot 100, "Dark Horse" has also topped [[Mainstream Top 40|Pop Songs]], giving Perry her 11th number-one. This feat tied her with [[Rihanna]] for most number ones on [[Mainstream Top 40|Pop Songs]] chart. "Dark Horse" has also topped the ''Billboard'' [[Hot Dance Club Songs]] thus becoming her 13th number one and breaking her own record for most consecutive number ones. Her earlier record which was established upon her second single "[[Unconditionally (song)|Unconditionally]]" topping the chart was 12 consecutive number ones.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/5901178/chart-highlights-u2-makes-history-on-alternative-songs-with |title=Chart Highlights: U2 Makes History On Alternative Songs With 'Invisible' |first=Gary |last=Trust |work=Billboard |date=February 10, 2014 |accessdate=February 11, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140302012154/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/chart-beat/5901178/chart-highlights-u2-makes-history-on-alternative-songs-with |archivedate=March 2, 2014 }}</ref>
In Canada, the song has reached the top-spot position, becoming the singer's tenth number-one single in the country and Juicy J's first.<ref>{{cite web|title=Katy Perry - Chart history |url=http://www.billboard.com/artist/305595/Katy+Perry/chart?f=793 |work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |accessdate=January 9, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140629090241/http://www.billboard.com/artist/305595/Katy%20Perry/chart?f=793 |archivedate=June 29, 2014 }}</ref>
===Oceania and Europe=== On the week-ending September 23, 2013, "Dark Horse" debuted at number ten on the [[New Zealand Singles Chart]] becoming Perry's twelfth top ten.<ref name="nzchart2">{{cite web|url=http://nztop40.co.nz/chart/singles?chart=2273 |title=NZ Chart: Week of September 23, 2013 |work=Charts.org.nz |publisher=Hung Medien |accessdate=September 27, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140103151034/http://nztop40.co.nz/chart/singles?chart=2355 |archivedate=January 3, 2014 }}</ref> Five weeks later, the song peaked at number two, and charted in the top 10 for a total of 16 weeks. It has gone on to receive double platinum certification, and spent 37 weeks in the top 40.<ref>{{cite web|title=KATY PERRY FEAT. JUICY J - DARK HORSE (SONG)|url=http://charts.org.nz/showitem.asp?interpret=Katy+Perry+feat%2E+Juicy+J&titel=Dark+Horse&cat=s|work=Charts.org.nz|publisher=Hung Medien|accessdate=January 27, 2014}}</ref> In Australia, the song was not eligible to chart on the [[ARIA Charts|ARIA Top 100 Singles Chart]]<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.noise11.com/news/pharrell-williams-vs-inxs-on-next-chart-midweek-sales-20140312 |title=Pharrell Williams Vs INXS On Next Chart MIDWEEK SALES |publisher=Noise11 |last=Ryan |first=Gavin |date=March 12, 2014 |accessdate=August 13, 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140409010031/http://www.noise11.com/news/pharrell-williams-vs-inxs-on-next-chart-midweek-sales-20140312 |archivedate=April 9, 2014 }}</ref>{{why|date=August 2018}} but peaked at number five on the ARIA Top 50 Digital Tracks.<ref>{{cite journal|url=http://pandora.nla.gov.au/pan/23790/20131024-0000/issue1232.pdf|title=ARIA Report: Week Commencing 7 October 2013|date=October 24, 2013|publisher=[[Pandora Archive]]|issue=1232|format=PDF|accessdate=August 13, 2015}}</ref>
In the UK, on September 22, 2013, "Dark Horse" debuted at number 21 on the [[UK Singles Chart]].<ref name="UKSinglesChart">{{cite web|url=http://www.officialcharts.com/archive-chart/_/1/2013-09-28 |title=2013 Top 40 Official Singles Chart UK Archive: 28th September 2013 |publisher=[[Official Charts Company]] |accessdate=September 25, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130926184927/http://www.officialcharts.com/archive-chart/_/1/2013-09-28 |archivedate=September 26, 2013 }}</ref> It re-entered the chart at number 19 on February 2, 2014. Four weeks later, it reached a new peak of number 4. On January 23, 2014 the song re-entered the [[Irish Singles Chart]] at number 47<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.chart-track.co.uk/index.jsp?c=p%2Fmusicvideo%2Fmusic%2Farchive%2Findex_test.jsp&ct=240001&arch=t&lyr=2014&year=2014&week=4 |title=Irish Singles Chart |accessdate=February 26, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140219051837/http://www.chart-track.co.uk/index.jsp?c=p%2Fmusicvideo%2Fmusic%2Farchive%2Findex_test.jsp&ct=240001&arch=t&lyr=2014&year=2014&week=4 |archivedate=February 19, 2014 }}</ref> then reached a peak of 3.{{citation needed|date=September 2014}}
On the week-ending October 10, 2013 the song entered the [[Single Top 100|Dutch Mega Top 100]] chart at number 74, when "Dark Horse" was just a promotional song from the album. More than three months later, when the song was released as the third official single, "Dark Horse" re-entered the chart at number 28. Six weeks later, the song topped the chart.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://dutchcharts.nl/showitem.asp?interpret=Katy+Perry+feat%2E+Juicy+J&titel=Dark+Horse&cat=s|title=Dutch Mega Top 100|accessdate=February 26, 2014}}</ref> The song also reached the top spot position on the [[Dutch Top 40]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.top40.nl/top40/2014/week-8 |title=Dutch Top 40 |accessdate=February 26, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140225221552/http://www.top40.nl/top40/2014/week-8 |archivedate=February 25, 2014 }}</ref> In Austria, the Czech Republic, Norway and Sweden, the song peaked at number 2. "Dark Horse" also managed to reach the top 10 in Finland and Denmark where it respectively peaked at number 5 and 6. "Dark Horse" topped the Belgian Ultratop 50 Flandre chart and reached the top 10 in other European countries such as France and Germany.{{citation needed|date=September 2014}} In Italy, on the week-ending March 13, 2014, the song entered the [[Federazione Industria Musicale Italiana|FIMI]] official top 20 at number 17 and, after five weeks, it has so far reached a peak of number 5. It has also been certified gold for sales of 15,000 copies.{{citation needed|date=September 2014}}
==Music video== ===Background and production=== In an interview with ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' at the [[56th Annual Grammy Awards|2014 Grammy Awards]], Juicy J stated the video will be filmed "soon"; he added that it is "a major motion picture." He further teased the release by saying, "I can't really tell you because it's definitely going to be a surprise, but I'll tell you this much right here: you've seen her other videos, this one's gonna be just as big. Everything she does is like grade A."<ref>{{cite web|title=Juicy J Talks 'Dark Horse' Collaboration, Potential New Album |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/events/grammys-2014/5885494/juicy-j-talks-dark-horse-collaboration-and-video-potential-new |work=Billboard |accessdate=January 28, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140131071033/http://www.billboard.com/articles/events/grammys-2014/5885494/juicy-j-talks-dark-horse-collaboration-and-video-potential-new |archivedate=January 31, 2014}}</ref>
When "Dark Horse" had attained the top position on the US ''Billboard'' Hot 100 Chart, Perry announced that she was working on the video. "<ref name="NumberOneBillboard" /> On February 6, 2014, Perry tweeted the video would be released "soon".<ref>{{cite tweet|user=katyperry|number=431317371798552576|author=Katy Perry|date=February 6, 2014|title=Ermagherd derk herse holds steady for the 2nd week @ #1! THANK YEW! Would you like a video? Okee! Hold yer herses...SOON!}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.pressparty.com/pg/newsdesk/katyperry/view/103748/?isworld=y |title=Katy Perry promises video "soon" as 'Dark Horse' stays at No.1 in US |work=Press Party |date=February 6, 2014 |accessdate=July 7, 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150708070706/http://www.pressparty.com/pg/newsdesk/katyperry/view/103748/?isworld=y |archivedate=July 8, 2015 }}</ref> On February 13, 2014, she released a preview of the music video onto her [[Vevo]] account on [[YouTube]], revealing the Egyptian setting of the video. Perry played a character named "Katy Pätra", a takeoff on the [[Egyptians|Egyptian]] queen [[Cleopatra]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Katy Perry – Dark Horse (Music Video Preview) |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vwqiKh1twTM |publisher=YouTube |date=February 13, 2014 |last=Perry |first=Katy |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20161205134517/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vwqiKh1twTM |archivedate=December 5, 2016 }}</ref> The video was released on February 20, 2014.<ref name="VidRelease">{{cite news|last=Montgomery |first=James |title=Katy Perry's 'Dark Horse' Video Premieres: Watch It Now |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1722651/katy-perry-dark-horse-video/ |publisher=MTV News |accessdate=February 20, 2014 |date=February 20, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140707001539/http://www.mtv.com/news/1722651/katy-perry-dark-horse-video/ |archivedate=July 7, 2014}}</ref>
The music video was directed by [[Mathew Cullen]], who previously worked with Perry on her music video for the song "[[California Gurls]]". Perry's idea for the music video was to combine Ancient Egyptian culture with Memphis, Tennessee [[hip hop]]: setting the video in ancient [[Memphis, Egypt]] as a nod to Juicy J's Tennessee hometown. Speaking of Perry's concept, Cullen said "That's music to my ears — when an artist has a couple concepts that they want to mash up to create something fresh."<ref name="TimeMagazine">{{cite journal|last=Rothman |first=Lily |title=Katy Perry Dark Horse Music Video: Egypt Setting Gets OK from Experts |url=http://entertainment.time.com/2014/02/21/katy-perry-dark-horse-egypt/ |magazine=Time |accessdate=February 24, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140223223043/http://entertainment.time.com/2014/02/21/katy-perry-dark-horse-egypt/ |archivedate=February 23, 2014}}</ref>
===Synopsis=== [[File:Dark Horse Disintegration.png|thumb|right|The video was criticized for including a scene where Perry's character disintegrated a man (pictured), originally seen wearing a pendant appearing to display the [[Arabic language|Arabic]] word for "[[Allah]]", which was subsequently edited out of the video]] During the video's opening, it is revealed that the music video takes place "a crazy long time ago" in [[Memphis, Egypt]]. For the opening verses, Perry's character Katy Pätra, the witch of Memphis, is shown wearing a white dress and white and blue wig while floating on a large [[barge]] at sunset, with pyramids and palm trees visible in the background. The video transitions to a different scene where Pätra, now wearing a longer dress and a black wig, sits in an extravagant [[Sphinx]]-like throne while pharaohs gather to bring her expensive gifts (such as a large [[diamond]]) in an attempt to "win her heart."
After retrieving the first suitor's gift, she hits the man with a magical bolt of lightning from her hand, turning him into a pile of sand, and takes his jewels to wear on her teeth as a [[grill (jewelry)|grill]]. Another suitor brings her [[candy]], [[cupcake]]s, [[twinkie]]s, and spicy [[cheese puffs]]. After she burns her mouth with the spicy cheese puffs, she turns the suitor into a large cup of water, which she drinks. Pätra also appears as a gray statue in a scene where golden pythons and gray guardian statues such as [[Anubis]], [[Horus]], [[Nisroch]] and [[Apep]] surround her, and in a scene with a blue background where she wears a golden dress and several golden hieroglyphs levitate around her.
During Juicy J's verse, the rapper emerges from a gold [[sarcophagus]] while Pätra accepts an Egyptian chariot with hydraulics (she turns the associated suitor into a set of giant dice to hang from the frame) and rejects a suitor who turns out to have the [[Sobek|face of a crocodile]] by turning him into a wallet. During the final chorus, the last suitor brings Pätra a large gold pyramid with a pink capstone, which she ascends. At the top of the pyramid, Pätra, dressed as [[Isis]], uses her powers to conjure up a magical "perfect storm" with pink, purple, and violet clouds. Although it seems like Pätra has finally found a gift she likes, the final frame of the video reveals that she has turned the final suitor into a dog with a human head.
===Reception=== The music video was criticized by some for appropriating the symbols and imagery of Egyptian culture. Cullen, the director, defended the music video, saying that, while he believes it is dangerous to rip things directly from present cultures without adding anything to them, Ancient Egypt is part of what he calls our "shared collective mythology". He said: "The most important thing is that when you create something, and this is actually something Katy and I worked to do — you bring a new spin to it." Egyptologist [[David P. Silverman]] praised the music video's use of Egyptian imagery and the interest it could generate to viewers: "[Egypt has] always been a part of popular culture. It encourages people to think of these things, and some of those people actually begin to learn a lot." The video was noted by conspiracy theorists for bearing resemblance to imagery used by the alleged [[Illuminati]], but Ritner rejected the allegations, saying that "The many discussions of the Illuminati are nonsense" and that, in fact, the [[Freemasonry|masonic]] imagery associated with the Illuminati is drawn from Egyptian imagery (as a common source for both).<ref name="TimeMagazine" />
On June 9, 2015, the music video for "Dark Horse" became the first video by a female artist to reach 1 billion views on [[Vevo]].<ref>{{cite journal|title=Katy Perry's 'Dark Horse' Passes 1 Billion Vevo Views |first=Erin |last=Strecker |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/6590902/katy-perry-dark-horse-1-billion-vevo-views |magazine=Billboard |date=June 10, 2015 |accessdate=June 10, 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150612233806/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/6590902/katy-perry-dark-horse-1-billion-vevo-views |archivedate=June 12, 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Katy Perry Just Beat Taylor Swift To A Huge Milestone |first=Gil |last=Kaufman |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/2181184/katy-perry-dark-horse-billion-video-taylor-swift/ |publisher=MTV News |date=June 9, 2015 |accessdate=June 9, 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150610090021/http://www.mtv.com/news/2181184/katy-perry-dark-horse-billion-video-taylor-swift/ |archivedate=June 10, 2015}}</ref> Perry also became the first female to have a video on [[YouTube]] with 1 billion views.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.seventeen.com/celebrity/music/news/a31487/katy-perry-just-left-taylor-swift-in-the-dust-on-youtube/ |title=Katy Perry Just Left Taylor Swift in the Dust on YouTube |publisher=[[Seventeen (American magazine)]] |accessdate=August 1, 2015 |date=June 9, 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150723153039/http://www.seventeen.com/celebrity/music/news/a31487/katy-perry-just-left-taylor-swift-in-the-dust-on-youtube/ |archivedate=July 23, 2015}}</ref> As of September 2018, the video has received over 2.4 billion views on YouTube, making it the [[List of most viewed YouTube videos#All-time|fourteenth most viewed video of all time]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Most Viewed Videos of All Time (Over 375 million views) |url=https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLirAqAtl_h2r5g8xGajEwdXd3x1sZh8hC |publisher=YouTube |accessdate=July 7, 2015 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160809182529/https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLirAqAtl_h2r5g8xGajEwdXd3x1sZh8hC |archivedate=August 9, 2016}}</ref>
====Accusations of blasphemy==== The music video caused controversy among some [[Muslim]]s who criticized a scene in the video where a man wearing a [[pendant]] appearing to display the [[Arabic]] word for "[[Allah]]" is disintegrated and turned into sand by Perry's character. The scene took place 1 minute and 15 seconds into the video. A petition launched on [[Change.org]] accused Perry of "representing an opposition of God" and demanded that the video be taken down from [[YouTube]]. The petition reached over 65,000 signatures and as a response, the pendant was digitally removed from the video on February 26, 2014, after which the petition was closed.<ref>{{cite web|title=Katy Perry Dark Horse video edited |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-26366249 |publisher=BBC News |accessdate=February 27, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140227124602/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-26366249 |archivedate=February 27, 2014}}</ref>
==Copyright infringement lawsuit== On July 1, 2014, the ''[[St. Louis Post-Dispatch]]'' reported that Christian rapper [[Flame (rapper)|Flame]] and others filed a lawsuit against Perry, Capitol Records, and Perry's co-writers for infringing copyright on the song "Joyful Noise", which appeared on the 2008 album ''[[Our World: Redeemed]]''.<ref name="post-dispatch">{{cite web|last1=Patrick |first1=Robert |title=St. Louis Christian hip-hop singers sue Katy Perry over 'Dark Horse' |url=http://www.stltoday.com/news/local/crime-and-courts/st-louis-christian-hip-hop-singers-sue-katy-perry-over/article_a18ee60f-8f8d-5e5e-bdb1-cbfaff93597d.html |website=[[St. Louis Post-Dispatch]] |accessdate=July 3, 2014 |date=July 1, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140820073736/http://www.stltoday.com/news/local/crime-and-courts/st-louis-christian-hip-hop-singers-sue-katy-perry-over/article_a18ee60f-8f8d-5e5e-bdb1-cbfaff93597d.html |archivedate=August 20, 2014 }}</ref> Flame's DJ, Cho'zyn Boy, stated that Perry's song is "identical" to "Joyful Noise", but ten BPM slower in tempo and one step higher in pitch.<ref name="rapzilla">{{cite web|last1=Daniels |first1=David |title=Flame's DJ Explains Why 'Joyful Noise' and Katy Perry's 'Dark Horse' Are Similar |url=http://www.rapzilla.com/rz/news/38-backstage/8695-flames-dj-explains-why-joyful-noise-and-katy-perrys-dark-horse-are-similar |website=[[Rapzilla]] |publisher=Philip Rood and Chad Horton |accessdate=July 3, 2014 |date=July 2, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140706182725/http://www.rapzilla.com/rz/news/38-backstage/8695-flames-dj-explains-why-joyful-noise-and-katy-perrys-dark-horse-are-similar |archivedate=July 6, 2014 }}</ref> In addition to the infringement claims, the suit claims that "by any measure, the devoutly religious message of 'Joyful Noise' has been irreparably tarnished by its association with the witchcraft, paganism, black magic, and Illuminati imagery evoked by the same music in 'Dark Horse'".<ref name="huffpo">{{cite web|last1=Sieczkowski |first1=Cavan |title=Christian Singers Sue Katy Perry Over 'Dark Horse' |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/07/02/christian-singers-sue-katy-perry-dark-horse-_n_5552496.html |publisher=[[The Huffington Post]]. [[Arianna Huffington]] |accessdate=July 3, 2014 |date=July 2, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140703011143/http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/07/02/christian-singers-sue-katy-perry-dark-horse-_n_5552496.html |archivedate=July 3, 2014 }}</ref> Rapper [[Lecrae]], who is featured on the song and named in the lawsuit, clarified to MTV that "I was in Hong Kong [when] the press release went out and it's not my song — it's my guy Flame's song and I respect everyone's intellectual properties — but that statement about the witchcraft and stuff, that's not my statement and I don’t stand behind that statement."<ref>{{cite web|last1=Nadeska |first1=Alexis |title=Is Lecrae Really Involved In A Katy Perry Lawsuit? Not So Fast |url=http://www.mtv.com/news/1876925/lecrae-responds-katy-perry-lawsuit/ |publisher=[[MTV News]] [[Viacom]] |accessdate=July 25, 2014 |date=July 23, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140726202025/http://www.mtv.com/news/1876925/lecrae-responds-katy-perry-lawsuit/ |archivedate=July 26, 2014 }}</ref>
==Live performances== [[File:Katy Perry - The Prismatic (Newark) 06.jpg|thumb|175px|left|Perry performing "Dark Horse" at [[The Prismatic World Tour]]]] "Dark Horse" was first performed at the [[iHeartRadio Music Festival]] in [[Las Vegas]] on September 20, 2013.<ref name="MTV">{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1714419/katy-perry-iheart-radio.jhtml |title=Katy Perry Brings The Hits And Juicy J! To iHeartRadio Music Festival |publisher=MTV News |accessdate=September 25, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130924000908/http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1714419/katy-perry-iheart-radio.jhtml |archivedate=September 24, 2013 }}</ref> It was later performed at the [[iTunes Festival]] in London.<ref name="Katy debuts Walking on Air in London">{{cite web |url=http://www.belfasttelegraph.co.uk/entertainment/music/news/katy-perry-closes-itunes-festival-29622275.html?|title=Katy Perry closes iTunes Festival |work=The Belfast Telegraph |accessdate=October 1, 2013}}</ref> Perry also performed the song with Juicy J at the We Can Survive event at the [[Hollywood Bowl]] on October 23.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://globalgrind.com/2013/10/24/katy-perry-juicy-j-dark-horse-performance-video-we-can-survive-charity-concert/ |accessdate=February 16, 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222141534/http://globalgrind.com/2013/10/24/katy-perry-juicy-j-dark-horse-performance-video-we-can-survive-charity-concert/ |archivedate=February 22, 2014 }}</ref> Perry also performed "Dark Horse" on ''[[The Voice of Germany]]'' on December 13, 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.directlyrics.com/watch-katy-perry-performs-dark-horse-unconditionally-on-the-voice-of-germany-news.html |title=Katy Perry Performs 'Dark Horse' & 'Unconditionally' on 'The Voice of Germany' |publisher=directlyrics.com |date=December 14, 2013 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131219091947/http://www.directlyrics.com/watch-katy-perry-performs-dark-horse-unconditionally-on-the-voice-of-germany-news.html |archivedate=December 19, 2013 }}</ref> Perry and Juicy J performed the song at the [[56th Annual Grammy Awards]] on January 26, 2014. The "dark and mysterious" performance featured a "haunted forest" design with [[animatronic]] horses, broomstick pole dances, and a controlled fire.<ref name="GrammyPerformance2014">{{cite web|last=Rogulewski |first=Charley |title=Katy Perry And Juicy J Perform 'Dark Horse' At 2014 Grammys |url=http://www.vibe.com/article/watch-katy-perry-and-juicy-j-perform-dark-horse-2014-grammys |work=Vibe |date=January 26, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140129021850/http://www.vibe.com/article/watch-katy-perry-and-juicy-j-perform-dark-horse-2014-grammys |archivedate=January 29, 2014 }}</ref> The singer also performed the song at the [[2014 BRIT Awards]] and the performance featured a neon-colored Egyptian theme, like the music video.<ref>{{cite web|last=Lee |first=Ashley |title=Katy Perry Goes Egyptian Neon for 'Dark Horse' At BRIT Awards: Watch |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/5908538/katy-perry-goes-egyptian-neon-for-dark-horse-at-brit-awards-watch |publisher=Nielsen |date=February 19, 2014 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140301230104/http://www.billboard.com/articles/columns/pop-shop/5908538/katy-perry-goes-egyptian-neon-for-dark-horse-at-brit-awards-watch |archivedate=March 1, 2014 }}</ref>
On February 1, 2015, the song was performed by Perry during the [[Super Bowl XLIX halftime show]], where she was on a chessboard, with her dancers as chess pieces. It was one of the most technical performance out of the rest of the performances.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Lipshutz |first1=Jason |title=Katy Perry Shines During Super Bowl XLIX Halftime Show |url=http://www.billboard.com/articles/events/super-bowl-2015/6458199/katy-perry-super-bowl-xlix-halftime-show-review |accessdate=February 1, 2015 |work=[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]] |agency=[[Prometheus Global Media]] |date=February 1, 2015 |location=United States |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150203202853/http://www.billboard.com/articles/events/super-bowl-2015/6458199/katy-perry-super-bowl-xlix-halftime-show-review |archivedate=February 3, 2015 }}</ref> {{clear}}

MP Film | distributor = [[Entertainment One]] | released = {{Film date|df=y|2013|09|05|Premiere|2013|09|20|United Kingdom}} | runtime = 113 minutes{{cite web|title=''DIANA'' (12A)|url=http://www.bbfc.co.uk/releases/diana-film|work=[[E1 Films]]|publisher=[[British Board of Film Classification]]|date=10 September 2013|accessdate=10 September 2013}} | country = United Kingdom
France

French

Dutch | budget = $15 million{{cite web|url=http://www.darkhorizons.com/films/1917/Diana |archive-url=https://archive.is/20140527170757/http://www.darkhorizons.com/films/1917/Diana |dead-url=yes |archive-date=27 May 2014 |title=Diana |publisher=[[Dark Horizons]] |accessdate=1 November 2013 }} | gross = $21.7 million{{cite web |url=http://www.boxofficemojo.com/movies/?id=diana.htm |title=Diana (2013) |publisher=[[Box Office Mojo]] |accessdate=14 November 2013}} }} '''''Diana''''' is a 2013 [[Biographical film|biographical]] drama film, directed by [[Oliver Hirschbiegel]], about the last two years of the life of [[Diana, Princess of Wales]].{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/movies/news/a391517/naomi-watts-princess-diana-biopic-renamed-diana-first-picture.html|title=Naomi Watts Princess Diana biopic renamed 'Diana' – first picture|work=Digital Spy| date=4 July 2012|accessdate=4 July 2012|author=Dibdin, Emma}} The screenplay is based on Kate Snell's 2001 book, ''Diana: Her Last Love'', and was written by [[Stephen Jeffreys]]. Anglo-Australian actress [[Naomi Watts]] plays the title role of Diana. The world premiere of the film was held in London on 5 September 2013.{{cite news|title=Naomi Watts prepares to rock as Princess Diana|url=http://www.pakistantoday.com.pk/2013/06/26/news/entertainment/naomi-watts-prepares-to-rock-as-princess-diana/|accessdate=26 June 2013|newspaper=Pakistan Today|date=26 June 2013}}{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-23985665 |title=Diana film slammed by British press |website=BBC News| date=6 September 2013 |accessdate=6 September 2013}} It was released in the UK on 20 September 2013.{{cite news|title=Film highlights of autumn 2013: from Diana to The Selfish Giant|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2013/sep/01/best-films-autumn-2013-diana-selfish-giant|accessdate=7 September 2013|newspaper=The Guardian|date=1 September 2013|author=Peter Bradshaw}} The film received negative reviews from both the British and American critics. ==Plot== The film depicts the last two years of the princess's life, beginning with events when [[Diana, Princess of Wales|Diana]] ([[Naomi Watts]]) divorces [[Charles, Prince of Wales]]. She meets and falls in love with Pakistani [[Cardiac surgery|heart surgeon]], [[Hasnat Khan]] ([[Naveen Andrews]]). The film depicts her historic tours of [[Angola]], in her campaign against the use of land mines. Trips to causes in [[Australia]], [[Pakistan]], [[New York City]], [[Bosnia]], [[Italy]], and ultimately, [[Paris]] are also shown, with recreations of the fashions she wore in real life. Her desire for a life with Khan ends due to his wish for a private life and objections to her celebrity. The film depicts her dating of Egyptian [[Dodi Fayed]] as an attempt to make Khan jealous, but it ends with the car crash that killed Diana, Fayed, and Fayed's driver in the [[Pont de l'Alma|Pont Alma Tunnel]], in [[Paris]] – however, there is no re-enactment of the crash scene. ==Cast== * [[Naomi Watts]] as [[Diana, Princess of Wales]] * [[Naveen Andrews]] as [[Hasnat Khan|Dr. Hasnat Khan]] * [[Cas Anvar]] as [[Dodi Fayed]] * [[Laurence Belcher]] as [[Prince William, Duke of Cambridge|Prince William]] * Harry Holland as [[Prince Harry]] * [[Douglas Hodge]] as [[Paul Burrell]]{{cite news|title=New Princess Diana movie features iconic Sunday Mirror front page|url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/new-princess-diana-movie-features-1955234|accessdate=17 June 2013|newspaper=Daily Mirror|date=15 June 2013}} * [[Geraldine James]] as Oonagh Toffolo * [[Charles Edwards (English actor)|Charles Edwards]] as Patrick Jephson * [[Mary Stockley]] as Assistant * [[Juliet Stevenson]] as Sonia ==Production== The screenplay, which is based on Kate Snell's 2001 book, ''Diana: Her Last Love'',{{cite news|title=Princess Diana film 'got it completely wrong' says former lover Hasnat Khan|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2013/aug/26/princess-diana-film-gossip-former-lover|accessdate=26 August 2013|newspaper=The Guardian|date=26 August 2013|author=Andrew Pulver}} was written by [[Stephen Jeffreys]]. Robert Bernstein and [[Douglas Rae (TV executive)|Douglas Rae]] produced the movie for Ecosse Films.{{cite web|url=http://filmmusicreporter.com/2013/06/17/rachel-portman-scoring-oliver-hirschbiegels-diana/|title=Rachel Portman Scoring Oliver Hirschbiegel's 'Diana'|website=Film Music Reporter|date=17 June 2013 |accessdate=23 June 2013}} British actress [[Naomi Watts]] plays the title role.{{cite news|last=Bamigboye|first=Baz|title=Naomi Watts' Diana biopic to open on September 5th|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2332097/Naomi-Watts-Princess-Diana-biopic-open-September-5th--just-days-sixteenth-anniversary-death.html?ito=feeds-newsxml|accessdate=28 May 2013|newspaper=Daily Mail|date=28 May 2013}} Key scenes involving Diana and Dodi Fayed on his family yacht, ''Jonikal'', were filmed on the 45m Luxury Charter Yacht ''Princess Iolanthe''.{{cite news|last=Yacht Charter|first=Fleet|title=Princess Diana Movie – Yacht Chartered during filming with Naomi Watts|url=http://www.yachtcharterfleet.com/news/princess-diana-movie--yacht-chartered-during-filming-with-naomi-watts-1347.htm?ito=feeds-newsxml|work=YachtCharterFleet|date=6 September 2013}} The opening and closing scenes at the [[Hôtel Ritz Paris|Paris Ritz]] Imperial Suite were filmed at [[Fetcham Park House]] in [[Fetcham]], Surrey.[http://yareah.com/2013/09/2291-fetcham-park-stars-as-the-ritz-paris-in-diana-film Fetcham Park Stars As The Ritz, Paris In ‘Diana’ Film], Yareah, 30 September 2013 ==Reception== The film has received overwhelmingly negative reviews. On review aggregator ''[[Rotten Tomatoes]]'', it has an 8% approval rating based on reviews from 97 critics and an average score of 3.5/10. The consensus states: "Naomi Watts tries hard in the title role, but ''Diana'' buries her efforts under a shoddy script and clumsy direction."{{cite web |url=http://www.rottentomatoes.com/m/diana_2013/ |title=Diana |work=[[Rotten Tomatoes]] |publisher=[[Flixster]] |accessdate=23 September 2013}} On [[Metacritic]], the film has a 35 (out of 100), based on 28 reviews.{{cite web |url=http://www.metacritic.com/movie/diana/ |title=Diana |work=[[Metacritic]] |accessdate=14 January 2014}} David Edwards from ''[[Daily Mirror|The Mirror]]'' said it was a "cheap and cheerless effort that looks like a [[Channel 5 (UK)|Channel 5]] mid-week matinee" and that "[[Wesley Snipes]] in a blonde wig would be more convincing", awarding the film one star out of five.{{cite web |url=https://www.mirror.co.uk/lifestyle/going-out/film/diana-film-review-naomi-watts-2254659 |title=Diana film review |publisher=The Mirror |date=6 September 2013 |accessdate=6 September 2013}} [[Peter Bradshaw]] of ''[[The Guardian]]'' also awarded it one star out of five and called the film "car crash cinema".{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2013/sep/05/diana-review |title=Diana – review |work=The Guardian |date=6 September 2013 |accessdate=6 September 2013}} Joshua Rothkopf of ''[[Time Out (magazine)|Time Out New York]]'' called Watts's performance "extraordinary" and gave the film 3 stars out of 5, calling it "a restrained biopic that affords its subject the romantic privacy that life denied her."{{cite web |url=http://www.timeout.com/us/film/diana-movie-review |title=Diana: movie review (PG-13) |work=''[[Time Out (magazine)|Time Out New York]]'' |date=29 October 2013 |accessdate=30 October 2013}} [[Nigel Andrews]] of the ''[[Financial Times]]'' said that "once again Watts supplies the wattage" but that her performance is "frighteningly isolated... the compensating passion in a torpid drama."{{cite web |url=http://www.ft.com/cms/s/2/e1034134-210e-11e3-8aff-00144feab7de.html |title=Film reviews: Diana, Hawking, InRealLife, Kelly + Victor, The Call and Metro Manila |work=[[Financial Times]] |date=19 September 2013 |accessdate=30 October 2013}} Jim Schembri of [[3AW]] praised Watts' "impressive performance" but remarked that the film "could actually have done with another half-hour putting more meat onto the bones of these underdeveloped chapters of her story. "{{cite web |url=http://www.3aw.com.au/blogs/denis-walter-blog/new-release-movie-reviews--october-10/20131010-2v9vn.html |title=New release movie reviews - October 10 |work=[[3AW]] |date=10 October 2013 |accessdate=30 October 2013}} Dominic Corry of flicks.co.nz called the film "bad in the blandest way possible" and lamented that "Watts is let down by the [[Mills & Boon]]-level script".{{cite web |url=http://www.flicks.co.nz/blog/reviews/review-diana/ |title=REVIEW: DIANA |work=flicks.co.nz |date=10 October 2013 |accessdate=30 October 2013}} Fionnuala Halligan of ''[[Screen International|Screen Daily]]'' also criticised the writing, saying that Watts' "brave performance should not be under-estimated given the poverty of the dialogue and the pressure of the part."{{cite web |url=http://www.screendaily.com/reviews/the-latest/diana/5060086.article |title=Diana |work=''[[Screen International|Screen Daily]]'' |date=6 September 2013 |accessdate=30 October 2013}} Naomi Watts received a [[Razzie Award]] nomination for Worst Actress for her work in both this film and ''[[Movie 43]]'', where she lost to [[Tyler Perry]] for his performance in drag in ''[[A Madea Christmas (film)|A Madea Christmas]]''. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{Official website|http://www.officialdianamovie.com/}} * {{IMDb title|1758595|Diana}} * independent films]] [[Category:2010s romantic drama films]] [[Category:Belgian biographical films]] [[Category:Belgian drama films]] [[Category:Belgian films]] [[Category:Belgian independent films]]
